alert.note: Alert for Northern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 10 at 3:08PM EST until January 11 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON EST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 6 PM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills and very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 40 to 45 below zero expected late tonight and Tuesday morning. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero expected Tuesday afternoon. * WHERE...Northern Somerset County. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from midnight tonight to noon EST Tuesday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from noon to 6 PM EST Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Warning means the combination of very cold air and the wind will create dangerously low wind chill values. Frostbite can occur quickly and even hypothermia or death if precautions are not taken. A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and the wind will combine to create low wind chills. Frostbite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken. Make sure you wear a hat and gloves.
